text.p: Here are the major stories from Latvia's newspapers on Thursday. Prepared for Reuters by Co-operation Fund. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.

- Lithuania said on Wednesday it wanted to speed up negotiations with Latvia to resolve a sea border dispute. The zone in question is believed to contain considerable deposits of oil. Lithuania said it would consider any Latvian moves to drill in the area illegal.
- The Latvian cabinet on Tuesday approved a draft plan to dissolve local self-governments.
- The chief of the Riga morality police said there were at least 50 paedophiles in Riga and the number of sexual abuse cases against children was on the rise.
- Latvia's transport minister signed an agreement on sea transport with his counterpart from the Netherlands.
